rt

Interface Material

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Diffuse, PointLightMaterial

    public interface Material
    Materials implement functionality for shading surfaces using their BRDFs. Light sources are implemented using materials that return an emission term.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Material.ShadingSample
      Stores information about a shading sample.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean castsShadows()
      Indicate whether the material casts shadows or not.

      Evaluate BRDF for pair of incoming and outgoing directions.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateBRDF

        Spectrum evaluateBRDF(HitRecord hitRecord,
                    javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut,
                    javax.vecmath.Vector3f wIn)
        Evaluate BRDF for pair of incoming and outgoing directions. This method is typically called by an integrator when the integrator obtained the incident direction by sampling a point on a light source.
        Parameters:
        hitRecord - Information about hit point
        wOut - Outgoing direction, normalized and pointing away from the surface
        wIn - Incoming direction, normalized and pointing away from the surface
        Returns:
        BRDF value

      • evaluateEmission

        Spectrum evaluateEmission(HitRecord hitRecord,
                        javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut)
        Evaluate emission for outgoing direction. This method is typically called by an integrator when the integrator obtained the outgoing direction of the emission by sampling a point on a light source.
        Parameters:
        hitRecord - Information about hit point on light source
        wOut - Outgoing direction, normalized and pointing away from the surface
        Returns:
        emission value

      • hasSpecularReflection

        boolean hasSpecularReflection()
        Return whether material has perfect specular reflection.

      • evaluateSpecularReflection

        Material.ShadingSample evaluateSpecularReflection(HitRecord hitRecord)
        Evaluate specular reflection. This method is typically called by a recursive ray tracer to follow the path of specular reflection.

      • hasSpecularRefraction

        boolean hasSpecularRefraction()
        Return whether the material has perfect specular refraction.

      • evaluateSpecularRefraction

        Material.ShadingSample evaluateSpecularRefraction(HitRecord hitRecord)
        Evaluate specular refraction. This method is typically called by a recursive ray tracer to follow the path of specular refraction.

      • getShadingSample

        Material.ShadingSample getShadingSample(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                      float[] sample)
        Calculate a shading sample, given a uniform random sample as input. This method is typically called in a path tracer to sample and evaluate the next path segment. The methods decides which component of the material to sample (diffuse, specular reflection or refraction, etc.), computes an incident direction, and returns the BRDF value, the direction, and the probability density (stored in a Material.ShadingSample).

      • getEmissionSample

        Material.ShadingSample getEmissionSample(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                       float[] sample)
        Calculate an emission sample, given a hit record and a uniform random sample as input. This method is typically called in a bidirectional path tracer to sample and evaluate the first light path segment. The methods computes an outgoing direction, and returns the emission value, the direction, and the probability density (all stored in a Material.ShadingSample).

      • castsShadows

        boolean castsShadows()
        Indicate whether the material casts shadows or not.
